sourceMeaningMnemonic: From your <radical>mouth</radical> comes a <radical>cross</radical>, some <radical>flowers</radical>, and <radical>shellfish</radical>. It all <kanji>erupt</kanji>s from your mouth!
meaningInfo: Imagine these three things coming out of your mouth not one at a time, but all together like an eruption. Perhaps you're laying on your back, and they burst out of your mouth.
readingMnemonic: When do inanimate objects <kanji>erupt</kanji> from your mouth? Mostly when you're having <reading>fun</reading> (<ja>ふん</ja>).
readingInfo: It's really inconvenient that things erupt from your mouth whenever you're having fun. Makes it hard to have fun.
